oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Land grant and survey of William Simpson land in Davidson County (1784)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: 640 acres surveyed for William Simpson on the south side of the Cumberland River and crossing two branches of the west fork of Mill Creek. Warrant no. 31. Daniel Smith served as surveyor, while James Mulherin served as his deputy. James Ray and William Marshall served as chain carriers. A portion of this land was later sold to Michael Dunn (1810) and is the site of the Grassmere farm.

James Mulherin was amongst the earliest settlers in Davidson County. He was on the ballot for first surveyor of Davidson County, elected to the first grand jury, and was among the sureties for the entry taker and sheriff for the newly established county. Daniel Smith later beccame Tennessee's first Secretary of State.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mulherin, James
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Davidson County (Tenn.)--Maps; Surveys; Surveyors; Mill Creek (Williamson County and Davidson County, Tenn.)
